info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 09 at 3:24PM EDT until August 09 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Rabun County in northeastern Georgia... Southeastern Macon County in western North Carolina... Southwestern Transylvania County in western North Carolina... South central Jackson County in western North Carolina... North central Oconee County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 415 PM EDT. * At 323 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles northeast of Clayton, or 6 miles south of Highlands, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Highlands, Cashiers, Mountain Rest, Bad Creek, Pine Mountain, Whiteside Mountain, Sapphire, Lake Jocassee and Lake Glenville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Brief damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines over small areas. A brief period of large hail is also possible. Seek shelter inside an interior room. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
